Package tools

Class ImagesFromTiles

java.lang.Object
tools.ImagesFromTiles
public class ImagesFromTiles extends Object
This is the main class of the program. The object has two main methods for program management. The FillaArray() method that will reset the composition of the tiles and the DrawTiles() method that cycles through the composition and draws it and then saves it.
Author:
Fernando Tarrino del Pozo (FernandoEsra)
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • InitiateArray

      public void InitiateArray()
      Starts the array back to the values given in the constructor. By default Java fills the array with 0, this way we can use the same object if we want to generate different variations.

    • FillArray

      public void FillArray()
      First we start the array to clean it, then we go through the array and fill it with different numbers that will have their equivalent in tiles.

      Equivalences: 

       +-----------------------------+
 | int value | Tile dimensions |
 +-----------------------------+
 |     1     |      16x16      |
 +-----------------------------+
 |     2     |      16x32      |
 +-----------------------------+
 |     3     |      32x16      |
 +-----------------------------+
 |     4     |      32x32      |
 +-----------------------------+
 |     5     |      16x48      |
 +-----------------------------+
 |     6     |      48x16      |
 +-----------------------------+
      For each number, the initial coordinate (upper left) will be filled with the indicated number and the rest with -1 to indicate that they are reserved. For example if we have the following: 
       +---------+
 |1|1|2|2|3|
 +---------+
 |4|4|1|1|3|
 +---------+
 |4|4|2|2|1|
 +---------+
      In the array we will have: 
       +--------------+
 | 1| 1| 2|-1| 3|
 +--------------+
 | 4|-1| 1| 1|-1|
 +--------------+
 |-1|-1| 2|-1| 1|
 +--------------+
      In addition, there are different protections to avoid generating tiles that do not exist in the files. For example, if there are no 32x32 tiles, they will not be generated in those sizes.

    • RandomValue

      public int RandomValue(boolean two, boolean three, boolean four, boolean five, boolean six)
      Returns a value of type int to fill the array. There are different protections to know if a type of tile can be generated or not. The probabilities of each number are: 
       +-------------------------+
 | int value | Probability |
 +-------------------------+
 |     1     |     50%     |
 +-------------------------+
 |     2     |     10%     |
 +-------------------------+
 |     3     |     10%     |
 +-------------------------+
 |     4     |     10%     |
 +-------------------------+
 |     5     |     10%     |
 +-------------------------+
 |     6     |     10%     |
 +-------------------------+
      Parameters:
      two - Checks if there are 32x16 tiles in the corresponding array to be able to generate them.
      three - Checks if there are 16x32 tiles in the corresponding array to be able to generate them.
      four - Checks if there are 32x32 tiles in the corresponding array to be able to generate them.
      five - Checks if there are 48x16 tiles in the corresponding array to be able to generate them.
      six - Checks if there are 16x48 tiles in the corresponding array to be able to generate them.
      Returns:
      A correct Integer value to assign to the composition.

    • InBounds

      public boolean InBounds(int x, int y)
      Checks if provided coordinate are within the limits of the array
      Parameters:
      x - The coordinate for the height
      y - The coordinate for the width
      Returns:
      True if the coordinate is within the limits, false if not

    • IsValid

      public boolean IsValid(int x, int y)
      Checks if the provided coordinate is valid (it is within the limits of the array and has a 0 inside)
      Parameters:
      x - The coordinate for the height
      y - The coordinate for the width
      Returns:
      True if the coordinate is valid, false if not

    • PossibleTwo

      public boolean PossibleTwo(int x, int y)
      Check if it is possible to generate the shape assigned to number 2 (a 16 pixels high and 32 pixels wide tile). To do this, it checks whether both the given coordinate and the next coordinate (width + 1) are valid.
      Parameters:
      x - The coordinate for the height
      y - The coordinate for the width
      Returns:
      True if the form can be generated, false if not

    • PossibleThree

      public boolean PossibleThree(int x, int y)
      Check if it is possible to generate the shape assigned to number 3 (a 32 pixels high and 16 pixels wide tile). To do this, it checks if the given coordinate and the lower coordinate (height + 1) are valid.
      Parameters:
      x - The coordinate for the height
      y - The coordinate for the width
      Returns:
      True if the form can be generated, false if not

    • PossibleFour

      public boolean PossibleFour(int x, int y)
      Check if it is possible to generate the shape assigned to number 4 (a 32 pixels high and 32 pixels wide tile). To do this, check if the following coordinates are valid:

      - The given coordinate
      - The next coordinate in height (height + 1)
      - The next coordinate in width (width + 1)
      - The adjacent coordinate vertically moving forward (height +1 and width + 1)

      Parameters:
      x - The coordinate for the height
      y - The coordinate for the width
      Returns:
      True if the form can be generated, false if not

    • PossibleFive

      public boolean PossibleFive(int x, int y)
      Check if it is possible to generate the shape assigned to number 2 (a 16 pixels high and 48 pixels wide tile). To do this, check if the following two width coordinates are valid (width + 1 and width + 2)
      Parameters:
      x - The coordinate for the height
      y - The coordinate for the width
      Returns:
      True if the form can be generated, false if not

    • PossibleSix

      public boolean PossibleSix(int x, int y)
      Check if it is possible to generate the shape assigned to number 2 (a 48 pixels high and 16 pixels wide tile). To do this, check if the following two height coordinates are valid (height + 1 and height + 2)
      Parameters:
      x - The coordinate for the height
      y - The coordinate for the width
      Returns:
      True if the form can be generated, false if not

    • FetchTiles

      public void FetchTiles()
      This method starts all the arrays where we will save the images and will search the Tiles folder (which must be in the same path where the code is executed) for the different images and depending on their size, it will save them in the arrays.

      This method can throw an exception of type IOException if the Tiles folder does not exist.

      See Also:
      • IOException

    • DrawTiles

      public void DrawTiles()
      This method will be responsible for drawing the images based on the numbers generated in the composition array within a JFrame to later use a custom TilePanel and obtain the graphics with the use of Graphics2D. If the preview variable is true, at the end of the entire process it will use a Desktop object to open the system image manager and be able to see the result. This method may throw an IOException if it is not possible to save the resulting image.
      See Also:
      • IOException
      • ImagesFromTiles.TilePanel
      • JFrame
      • BufferedImage
      • Graphics2D
      • java.desktop
      • Desktop

    • ShowTiles

      public void ShowTiles()
      Method for debugging. It is used to see on the screen all the tiles that the arrays have.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Print the contents of the composition array
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
